        public FunctionsTest()

    • Method Detail

      • testNumber_of_rules

        public final void testNumber_of_rules()
                               throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Counts the number of lines in the file rules.cf defined by rules_path, which corresponds to the number of rules. To test this, it was created a test file with a number of rules and it was verified if the number of rules was the same as expected.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • testGet_rules

        public final void testGet_rules()
                         throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Returns an array with the rules inside rules_path. To test this, it was created a test file with a number of rules and after it was verified if the ArrayList of rules read from the file equals the test ArrayList created.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • testGet_weights

        public final void testGet_weights()
                           throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Returns an array with the weights inside rules2_path. To test this, it was created a test file with a number of weights and after it was verified if the ArrayList of weights read from the file equals the test ArrayList created.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • testWrite_weights

        public final void testWrite_weights()
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Writes in path (rules_write.cf, a test file created) the weights given on a arrayList. To test this we created two ArrayLists with the same elements. One was given on the function write_Weights. Then the function get_weights was called to read the weights of the file to a ArrayList and it was verified if the two ArrayLists were the same.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • testFile_to_array

        public final void testFile_to_array()
                             throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        It was created a test file with the structure of ham.log/spam.log. Then it was created an ArrayList of ArrayLists to simulate that each position corresponded to an email and each position then has another array that contains the rules the email breaks. Then it was verified if the ArrayList created equals the ArrayList read from the test file.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • testEvaluate_solution

        public final void testEvaluate_solution()
                                 throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Evaluates the solution returning the total of FP (type 0). To test this we put the weights of the test file on an ArrayList and then we evaluate the solution with the weights read and the given type.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • testEvaluate_solution2

        public final void testEvaluate_solution2()
                                  throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Evaluates the solution returning the total of FN (type 1). To test this we put the weights of the test file on an ArrayList and then we evaluate the solution with the weights read and the given type.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • testChoose_solution

        public final void testChoose_solution()
                               throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Chooses the best solution to a Mixed (Professional and Leisure) Mailbox. To test this it was created a test file with different solutions and then it was verified if the choosen solution was the best solution.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • testGet_solution

        public final void testGet_solution()
                            throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Returns an ArrayList with the solution in the line that we want. To test this we call the function get_solution giving the line of the expected solution (line starts at zero). And then we verify if the ArrayList returned is the same as test ArrayList created.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • testGet_FalseValues

        public final void testGet_FalseValues()
                               throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Returns FP and FN in a String[] of a given line. To test this we created a test String[] with the FN and FB expected and then was called the function to verify if every element of the return String[] equals the correspondent element of the test String[].
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
